intro: Selago retropilosa, commonly known as the backward-hair grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically green or pale in color. Selago retropilosa is often found in sandy or coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitats.
